organic_results.title: Occupational shifts and educational upgrading in the American labor force between 1950 and 1970
organic_results.snippet: This study replicates, for the period 1950 to 1970, Folger and Nam's technique for measuring the extent of upgrading in the labor force. The increase in education is divided into two components: shifts in the occupational structure in the direction of occupations requiring more education, and increases in the educational level within each occupational category. The analysis is confined to white males, 35-54, and to all males, 14 years old or over. It is found that, as in previous decades, most of the increase in the education of the …

publication_info.summary: O Rodriguez - Sociology of Education, 1978 - JSTOR
